skill.name: writing-clearly-and-concisely
skill.description: Apply Strunk's timeless writing rules to ANY prose humans will read—documentation, commit messages, error messages, explanations, reports, or UI text. Makes your writing clearer, stronger, and more professional.
skill.summary: Apply Strunk's timeless writing rules to ANY prose humans will read—documentation, commit messages, ...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only public domain text content (Strunk's Elements of Style) and documentation. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or environment variables. Pure text-based writing guidance with zero security risks.

content.user_title: Write Clearly with Strunk's Classic Rules
content.value_statement: Transform unclear writing into crisp, professional prose. This skill applies Strunk's timeless principles to make your documentation, messages, and explanations clearer and more effective.
actual_capabilities: Applies 18 fundamental writing rules from Strunk's Elements of Style
Provides grammar and punctuation guidance for professional writing
Offers specific examples of unclear vs clear writing
Includes comprehensive list of commonly misused words
Teaches active voice and concise expression techniques
Covers paragraph structure and composition principles
limitations: Consumes ~12,000 tokens when loading full style guide
Focuses on English language writing only
Classic rules may need adaptation for modern digital writing
No automatic editing - requires manual application of rules

use_cases.title: Write Better Documentation
use_cases.description: Apply clear writing principles to README files, API docs, and code comments for better developer experience.

use_cases.title: Improve Technical Explanations
use_cases.description: Use Strunk's rules to make complex technical concepts accessible and engaging for readers.

use_cases.title: Enhance Team Communication
use_cases.description: Write clearer commit messages, pull request descriptions, and team announcements that everyone understands.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Writing Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Please review this text and apply Strunk's principles to make it clearer and more concise: [paste your text]

prompt_templates.title: Documentation Improvement
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me rewrite this technical documentation using Strunk's rules. Focus on active voice, concrete language, and removing unnecessary words: [your documentation]

prompt_templates.title: Error Message Refinement
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Strunk's principles to make this error message clearer and more helpful for users: [error message text]

prompt_templates.title: Advanced Style Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this text using Strunk's Elements of Style. Identify specific violations of rules 10-18 and suggest concrete improvements: [your text]

output_examples.input: The implementation of the new feature was completed by the development team in a timely manner.
output: Active voice version: 'The development team implemented the new feature on time.'
More concise: 'The team shipped the feature on schedule.'

best_practices: Read the full elements-of-style.md when writing important prose for maximum impact
Use subagents for editing when context is limited to preserve tokens
Apply Orwell's 6 rules as a lightweight alternative when resources are tight
anti_patterns: Don't apply these rules to code syntax or configuration files
Avoid over-editing conversational text where natural flow matters more
Don't sacrifice technical accuracy for style - clarify instead of oversimplifying

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude versions?
faq.answer: Yes, works with all Claude models and Claude Code. The skill provides text guidance that any model can apply.

faq.question: How many tokens does the full style guide use?
faq.answer: The elements-of-style.md file consumes approximately 12,000 tokens. Use Orwell's rules for lightweight editing.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my writing workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, use it when drafting documentation, PR descriptions, or any human-facing text. Dispatch subagents for editing assistance.

faq.question: Is my writing data safe?
faq.answer: Absolutely. This skill only contains public domain text. No data is transmitted or stored externally.

faq.question: What if the rules seem outdated?
faq.answer: While written in 1918, Strunk's principles of clarity and concision remain timeless. Adapt examples to your context.

faq.question: How does this compare to modern style guides?
faq.answer: Strunk's rules complement modern guides by focusing on fundamental clarity. Use alongside tools like Grammarly for comprehensive coverage.
